full_text: Very sad news. Mary Jackman, a committed public representative, nationally but in particular for Limerick. She was a committed @FineGael person, loyal & hard working.  But most of all she was a really decent person, always thinking of others.  Sincere condolences to her family. https://t.co/XtR32rxszh

On #PKDay I’m privileged to be in #Lebanon with @MichealMartinTD An Taoiseach, to be with & thank @defenceforces for their ongoing professionalism & service to the cause of peace.  Irish peacekeepers have the longest unbroken service to the #UN of any nation. Very proud of that. https://t.co/j3L6LcoZcr
@PaulaCoganCork Very jealous - enjoy #bereisland in the ☀️

@pjcoogan Approx 7000 passports a day delivered this week (huge increase). Many adult renewals now done in 48 hrs. 1st time online applications can be delayed if verification/documentation is required, but otherwise being done in 30 working days. Working hard to deliver faster for people.

@hayward_katy Katy the truth always wins out. Your professionalism and accuracy means you’re credible and listened to. For some people that makes you a target.  Keep telling the truth. Northern Ireland needs people with your integrity. Thank you.  #Brexit

Update from passport office. Across Tue, Wed & Thurs this week we printed & issued 21,000 passports, an avg of 7,000 per day responding to unprecedented demand. Staff working flat out to deliver for the public. Quickest way to get a passport is online:  https://t.co/pGxbIFX7uG

Very positive meeting with friend an colleague Foreign Minister of #Latvia yesterday. Our shared solidarity & support for #Ukraine is absolute on tougher sanctions, Ukraines EU ambitions, humanitarian & military support and the search for peace. 🇮🇪🇱🇻🇪🇺 https://t.co/LjcA1K6NiK

Yesterday I visited the extraordinarily moving memorial in #Estonia to all those who suffered & were killed under communism and Russia.  If anyone questions why Europe needs to act together today to counter Russian aggression in #Ukraine : listen to our Baltic friends. 🇮🇪🇪🇺🇪🇪🇺🇦 https://t.co/BWDLRbH4fe

Great to visit #Estonia today to meet @eliimets to discuss Russia’s war of aggression, accountability for war crimes, supporting #Ukraine , #EU enlargement, cyber security and the NI Protocol. Strong agreement and solidarity on all issues. #solidarity  🇮🇪🇪🇪🇺🇦🇪🇺 https://t.co/R4r6SUdSkk

Good to get briefed by Comdt Rónán O’Flaherty of ⁦@defenceforces⁩ today in #Tallinn at the Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence. #Ireland is committed to maintaining and building new cyber security defence capacity with international partners. 🇮🇪🇪🇺🇪🇪 https://t.co/BgG8RiK0dV

Travelling to Tallinn tonight for political meetings in #Estonia & #Latvia tomorrow.  Just came through #Helsinki Airport on the way - the most efficient transfer I’ve ever experienced. You gotta love the Finns: Calm, Friendly, Tough, Efficient; great people. 🇫🇮 ⁦⁦#Finland https://t.co/pqk1ZFN8ty
A welcome step and consistent with delivery of the New Decade, New Approach Agreement. @dfatirl https://t.co/Euf3EZB6Y5

This is such a positive event. @IMART_worldcup is going to be a fantastic, inclusive international sporting event in #Cork.  Looking forward to big crowds & support.  Well done to all involved in making it happen @irishexaminer @sundayswellrfc @corkcitycouncil @RTEsport https://t.co/nhWMueet5l

This is positive progress and delivery on the New Decade, New Approach Agreement.  I’ve worked together with ⁦@BrandonLewis⁩ on this and welcome the Irish language and Ulster Scots bill to be introduced at Westminster.  ⁦🇮🇪🇬🇧 https://t.co/zcUhaYOpA6
Our deep condolences are with the victims families and all Americans mourning loss of precious life today, after such shocking violence and tragedy in Texas. ⁦@dfatirl⁩  https://t.co/pHJ8MjQzma

Very positive news. This has been in negotiation for years and will release hugely strategic quayside for city centre docklands development. Great work ⁦@corkcitycouncil⁩  - Cork City Council signs multi-million euro deal to buy Port of Cork.  https://t.co/XFkAZ0GGJm

Thank you @RepRichardNeal for your consistent & sincere friendship of #Ireland and support of Good Friday Agreement.  I look forward to continuing to work with you to strengthen Trans-Atlantic partnership and cooperation to promote peace and respect for international law. 🇮🇪🇺🇸 https://t.co/S0H32JUywY
Another big announcement for Cork today. ⁦@corkcitycouncil⁩ ⁦@Corkcoco⁩ #acityrising  Apple to significantly expand operations in Cork https://t.co/AYJ4eAlz92
Positive news… https://t.co/gtct6QIVHR
Positive trade numbers, north and South. All island trade and economy performing strongly post Covid. https://t.co/7uLqQ9DYjd
Great news for #Cork today. Congratulations to @Merck on a fantastic new investment. 370 new jobs, €440m investment. @Corkcoco @corkcitycouncil https://t.co/7EcdkYfP7q
Well done Fountainstown. great news for #CorkHarbour. @Corkcoco https://t.co/jsuyqq6l7I
Félicitations @CBeaune 🇫🇷🇮🇪 https://t.co/FiUSEp9xg7

Félicitations to ⁦@AmbColonna⁩ on becoming the new French Foreign Minister - looking forward to working with her to further build on already strong 🇮🇪 🇫🇷 relations. ⁦@dfatirl⁩  https://t.co/jyaohdJbT5

A real privilege to take over the Presidency of the Council of Europe at such an important time for Europe. Thank you to @ItalyatCoE for your strong leadership. We will do all we can to build on your success! @IrishRepCoE @dfatirl #CoEPresIRL https://t.co/C2Njk3SEUj

I met my German counterpart @ABaerbock in Turin. I thanked her for her statements & that of the Chancellor, standing up for international law & the #Brexit deal.  The EU is ready to find solutions in response to the concerns of Unionism in NI but needs a partner at the table. https://t.co/WFYhlftnvc
I met @trussliz in Turin. I made clear Ireland’s opposition to the U.K. breaching international law.   The UK needs to get back to talks with the EU. https://t.co/ZQwLAtz8Dv

I look forward to meeting @trussliz today to urge the U.K. Government to move away from threats of unilaterally breaching international law & damaging international relations.  EU remains ready to negotiate pragmatic solutions to outstanding Protocol issues through partnership. https://t.co/qI7WBqHphX
@PaulaCoganCork @CorkChamber Thanks Paula. You’ve done an incredible job through a very challenging period. Well done, great leadership.

On way to #Turin for a Council of Europe meeting where #Ireland takes the Presidency for the next 6 months.  We will do everything we can to give effective leadership at an extraordinary time of war and human suffering in #Europe.  Busy summer ahead! https://t.co/563yqBg0iu

I look forward to meeting @trussliz tomorrow in Turin. The message from #Ireland and #EU is clear: U.K. unilateral action is not the way to build trust and solve problems, partnership is.  EU remains ready to engage seriously but we need a partner. @dfatirl https://t.co/GliBFjlfTc
Privileged to be in Collins Barracks, Cork today. Marking a hundred years of extraordinary history with @defenceforces @IRLDeptDefence #StrengthenTheNation 🇮🇪 https://t.co/wFv9vy337o

Delighted to meet fantastic Ukrainian students from ⁦@GccFurtherEd⁩ in the Dail today with Noel Grealish TD. ⁦@DmytroKuleba⁩ your young people are a credit to #Ukraine ! 🇺🇦🇮🇪🇪🇺 https://t.co/njFRxTGZPJ
If you’re wondering what friends and allies think….. #Brexit https://t.co/RWnmM1AqZL

EU wants engagement with U.K. to progress and resolve issues, but will not accept unilateral legislation to set aside elements of an important International Agreement. @dfatirl https://t.co/4xftBlNNjZ
Privilege to be in Cathal Brugha Barracks today with @defenceforces and @IRLDeptDefence https://t.co/NujpNxeyYo
U.K. Government is co-guarantor…… now acting unilaterally. https://t.co/wZuO1bOLDu

I last night spoke to @trussliz & look forward to seeing her in person in Italy later this week. I made clear that breaking international law is not the answer to solving Protocol issues. The EU/UK negotiating teams haven’t met since Feb. Time to get back to the table. @dfatirl

Spoke to both @MarosSefcovic and @trussliz this evening. With engagement & political will most outstanding issues with Protocol can be resolved. Unilateral legislation, in breach of int law, is not the way for the U.K. to build a future relationship with the EU or Ireland. https://t.co/tIt9pQGdQC

Time for UK/EU partnership, compromise & dialogue to solve outstanding Protocol issues, not Unilateral action that breaches international law and further damages trust.  There is a landing ground that responds to legitimate concerns - let’s get there.  https://t.co/Gaedm6Ky3h
Todays Sunday ⁦@Telegraph⁩ - “Peace in Northern Ireland can only be protected with partnership and pragmatism.” 🇮🇪🇬🇧🇪🇺 https://t.co/NEqPhIN2ei
@UKRinIRL Congratulations on a great win @Eurovision. Europe is with you #SlavaUkraine 🇺🇦

These are disgraceful scenes of police brutality at a hugely sensitive funeral. No self respecting democracy could stand over this treatment of people.  Unacceptable and should be roundly condemned by international community. @dfatirl @irishmissionun https://t.co/IZxJB25fZs
I completely agree with this statement from @JosepBorrellF. These were disgraceful scenes that should be condemned. https://t.co/P4DcH6EE1j
Coveney urges probe into West Bank killing of reporter via @RTENews https://t.co/33j69jHjyz

Interesting thread. A reminder of the clear understanding, when protocol was agreed, of what it entailed.  Since then EU has shown significant flexibility on implementation to respond to concerns. EU is willing to do more, be needs partnership from UK. 🇪🇺🇬🇧 https://t.co/MBBL7b2Ch2

Spoke to @MarosSefcovic this evening. We are in agreement on U.K. Government threats of unilateral action & breach of Int. law.  The way forward is partnership, dialogue & genuine negotiation, not threats and raising tension. Solutions exist, let’s work them out together! 🇪🇺🇬🇧 https://t.co/XCTN3oWHQm
Clear and true. https://t.co/JShx8FGrmY
#EU50 https://t.co/FlerKdlFWh
Today is #EuropeDay and 50 years since #Ireland made the decision to join the EEC. 50 years of progress, growth, cooperation and modernisation. #EU50 https://t.co/9IXYUpelsk

Thank you @IrishTimes. James Kingston was such a warm person, with a razor sharp legal mind, a great sense of humour and passion for social justice. He made the @dfatirl a better place. https://t.co/FhmZoyjNzV

Congratulations to all elected. Despite a divisive election, I hope parties can now come together & find a way to form a functioning Assembly and Executive to serve the people of Northern Ireland.  We will work with all parties and the U.K. Govt to protect the GFA and NDNA. https://t.co/GMZdexNnps

Looking forward to Tullamore today. Great line up of speakers from Farming and AgriFood sector. @FineGael will always support and prioritise farming as the heartbeat of rural communities. #FGAgDay https://t.co/oI1F0tO8An
@PaulaCoganCork @MichealMartinTD @mmcgrathtd @CorkChamber Well done @PaulaCoganCork for a fantastic night last night. @CorkChamber

I strongly condemn yesterday’s terrorist attacks in Elad, Israel. This violence must stop and has absolutely no justification. My thoughts and sympathies are with the victims and their families. ⁦@dfatirl⁩ ⁦@irishmissionun⁩  https://t.co/B0k7x9bytS
@nealerichmond Very cute.

Good discussion with @trussliz today. Strong agreement on cooperation in support of #Ukraine & need for tough sanctions on #Russia.  I emphasised need for UK/EU/IRE partnership to solve outstanding NI Protocol issues. Unilateral action not the way forward. Agreed to keep talking. https://t.co/ktPaal7hgV

I’ve huge respect for @McHughJoeTD and for the decision he has made. He’s an friend, colleague and @FineGael person who has made a very significant contribution to national politics and to Donegal. I wish him and his family well. https://t.co/METuncUIvc

There’s been a lot of understandable comment in relation to this trash video on Russian State TV.  Let’s not allow ourselves be distracted from the real atrocities being committed by Russian Forces in #Ukraine by disinformation like this. #StandWithUkraine https://t.co/gM3mgkNF6M
The continuation and growth of this summer programme is so valuable for families. Good work @NormaFoleyTD1 and @josephamadigan https://t.co/MBgxZa3ctY

Ireland continues to advocate for the strongest possible EU sanctions. The 6th EU Sanctions Package will target Russian oil and more banks. The cost for #Russia of continued war must be very high, to maximise pressure to bring it to an end. 🇮🇪🇪🇺 https://t.co/hF471IWKBS

@yairlapid is absolutely correct to call out deeply offensive and inaccurate comments.  It seems Russia’s disinformation campaign to justify an unjustifiable war has no bounds.  #StandWithUkraine https://t.co/UqLRlOkBMf

@yairlapid is correct to call out Minister Lavrov for  comments that are deeply offensive and inaccurate.  It seems there is no end to the disinformation Russia will adopt as justification for an unjustifiable war. #StandWithUkraine https://t.co/UqLRlOl9BN
Amazing photo! What an incredible athlete and champion. Congratulations ⁦@KatieTaylor⁩ - you make so many people so proud. #Ireland https://t.co/6KqzXsDGvr
Best of luck to ⁦@KatieTaylor⁩ tonight. She continues to be an incredible role model and sporting inspiration. Biggest fight of her career, a country behind her! #Ireland 🇮🇪 https://t.co/33pPp91DG3
Good discussion today on the potential appointment of a new U.S. Special Envoy to Northern Ireland. 🇺🇸🇮🇪 https://t.co/jDEVlWj4Ai

Let’s not read too much into these #Brexit comments. They’re inaccurate, divisive and unhelpful, but not unexpected. The way forward is partnership and compromise to solve outstanding NI Protocol issues. I’m up for that, we always have been, as are the EU. https://t.co/4CJtq47FNP

A victory for #Europe tonight! Toutes nos sincères félicitations à @EmmanuelMacron pour sa victoire ce soir.  L’Irlande 🇮🇪 se réjouit de cinq années supplémentaires d’étroite collaboration avec la France 🇫🇷, notre plus proche voisin dans l’UE 🇪🇺 https://t.co/fDUP89RLm3

@irishmissionun is working with @LiechtenstienUN to get maximum support for this initiative. Use of the Veto in UN Security Council is often an abuse of power, undermines multilateralism and does not reflect majority opinion. #Ireland @dfatirl https://t.co/qVkYYWXlRy

The passing of James Kingston is heartbreaking. He was such an intelligent person, full of integrity & decency. His legal brain was never wrong. But his kindness & eagerness to help made him special. Deep condolences to his family and friends. Rest in peace James. @dfatirl https://t.co/cMfPuuUu41
And some wonder why trust is in short supply….. #Brexit https://t.co/rRPbvE7CTd

I spoke yesterday at #UN about the growing violence in Jerusalem & the risk of further escalation.  I’ll be speaking to Jordanian FM ⁦@AymanHsafadi⁩ today. - Statement on violence in Jerusalem ⁦@dfatirl⁩ ⁦@irishmissionun⁩  https://t.co/8s7MIiEQF9

Thanks to our fantastic team in New York for organising a very useful day at the #UN yesterday. #Ireland is fortunate to have such professionalism and dedication at @irishmissionun @dfatirl https://t.co/ZsIgRrG5zL

Shameful. There is absolutely no place for masked thugs marching anywhere on the island of Ireland. Our future won’t be shaped by paramilitary intimidation and the twisted views of an anti democratic tiny minority. https://t.co/AT6Um9IhnO
@FanningGrace @naval_service Happy Easter Grace and to all @naval_service personnel on duty. @defenceforces

@DmytroKuleba Dmytro, those who pray today are praying for Peace in #Ukraine and for those suffering the brutality of war across your country.  In the end, light always triumphs over darkness, always. Have faith and continued strength, the world is with you. #StandWithUkraine️
Some thoughts after visiting #Ukraine and #Kyiv. #StandWithUkraine ⁦@dfatirl⁩ ⁦@IRLDeptDefence⁩  https://t.co/Y8P0QpsO7Q

Powerful photograph. I was there to witness these mass graves yesterday in #Bucha. Brutal, shocking, tragic…. CRIMES that need full investigation to come before an International Court. @IntnCrimCourt @dfatirl @irishmissionun https://t.co/PWGce2ub4s

A residential area in #Bucha yesterday, 25mins from centre of #Kyiv. This is what #Russia’s war on #Ukraine looks like. #Ireland will do all we can to support #Ukraine and to end this aggression through tougher sanctions, accountability for Russian actions & intensive diplomacy. https://t.co/sJCKvHtbUU

What a fantastic group of people I’m privileged to work with at @dfatirl - their service at home and abroad to #Ireland through #Covid and multiple international challenges has been, and continues to be, inspiring. Great to kick off our 3 day conference this morning. 🇮🇪🇪🇺🇺🇳 https://t.co/FvgXFopA7j

Very concerning reports from a number of sources of the possible use of chemical weapons in Mariupol.  Urgent verification of facts needed by international partners. @irishmissionun @dfatirl https://t.co/qMKpWIBvum
Irish ports to deny entry to Russian-registered vessels ⁦@dfatirl⁩ ⁦@irishmissionun⁩  https://t.co/GuiMXnAWI7
#Ireland continues to be a strong supporter of #EU enlargement. #Ukraine #Moldova #Georgia 🇪🇺 https://t.co/SPfHbafqWN

Very happy to meet today with Minister @nicupopescu . A good opportunity to voice Ireland’s support for Moldova’s European perspective and to discuss how we can support Moldova and the Moldovan community in Ireland. https://t.co/AM11OQjHDG

Today at FAC I called on @EU_Commission to immediately release more than €200m of promised 2021 funding to Palestinian Authority that’s been blocked for months. Delay is impacting ordinary Palestinians & contributing to increased instability. Strong support from other ministers. https://t.co/L2iWMeAJDo

I strongly condemn this disgraceful, cowardly attack against a PSNI officer trying to help the community. There’s never a justification for violence like this. I urge anyone with information to share it with PSNI.  https://t.co/ztc6QGYSir
@Kelly64kg Congratulations - great photo, great message!
Just met #Irelands U19 Womens Volleyball Team in Luxembourg after winning their historic Silver Medal today. Really well done! 🇮🇪🇮🇪🇮🇪 @VolleyballIRL https://t.co/PjlLjHQRhi https://t.co/dAyVFHQm4N
